Issues.Title: Incorrect docs example of providers as acceptable selectors for the @ViewChild decorator
Issues.Body: # üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description [This PR](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38264) (#38264) was merged on July 28. In it, a change removing an example of **a service class as a provider-token selector for the ViewChild decorator** was made. The author of the change wrote in the PR description that: > `@ViewChild` doesn't work on service. However, the documentation says @ViewChild(SomeService) The `@ViewChild` decorator does query services classes configured as providers tokens in child components. [Here's an example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/view-child-service-provider-selector). The change was to the example of the third entry of acceptable selectors for `@ViewChild`. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/ff9f4de4f1147ba9ea6d17c31442a2eedcf4e0d2/packages/core/src/metadata/di.ts#L334-L335 In the change above, `SomeComponent` is not a provider but a component. The example given is more in line with the first entry of acceptable selectors (`@Component`). https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/ff9f4de4f1147ba9ea6d17c31442a2eedcf4e0d2/packages/core/src/metadata/di.ts#L330-L331 I believe this should be reverted back to what it was originally. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/1d844b9bd8140953487f291e352ff55656154b41/packages/core/src/metadata/di.ts#L334-L335 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This isn't exactly a reproduction but an example to show that you can query service class providers using the `@ViewChild` decorator. https://stackblitz.com/edit/view-child-service-provider-selector ### What's the affected URL? https://angular.io/api/core/ViewChild ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error No error. ## üåç Your Environment ``` Angular CLI: 10.0.4 Node: 12.9.0 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 10.0.7 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Ivy Workspace: Yes Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.1000.4 @angular-devkit/core 10.0.4 @angular-devkit/schematics 10.0.4 @angular/cli 10.0.4 @ngtools/webpack 10.0.4 @schematics/angular 10.0.4 @schematics/update 0.1000.4 rxjs 6.5.5 typescript 3.9.7 webpack 4.43.0 ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect docs example of providers as acceptable selectors for the @ViewChild decorator" (#38323)

Issues.Title: zone.js incorrectly throws an error when rejecting a Promise with the `DISABLE_WRAPPING_UNCAUGHT_PROMISE_REJECTION` flag enabled
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package zone.js ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description Recently the flag `DISABLE_WRAPPING_UNCAUGHT_PROMISE_REJECTION` was added with #35873 to allow disabling of the wrapping behavior that zone.js performs on rejected promise values. Unfortunately, when this flag is enabled the zone.js code throws an unexpected error when a non-Error value is rejected, due to the code attempting to set various properties on the rejected value regardless of type: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/31796e8e2fa78fb55ae0c8bf461c4ad742898363/packages/zone.js/lib/common/promise.ts#L209-L212 For example, if I reject a Promise with the value "42" the following error occurs: `Error: Cannot create property 'rejection' on number '42'` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/zonejs-disable-promise-reject-wrapping-issue ## üî• Exception or Error If I reject a Promise with the value "42" the following error occurs: 

`Error: Cannot create property 'rejection' on number '42'`
This is reproducible with any non-error value (number, string, null, etc.) ## üåç Your Environment From Stackblitz: **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.12
Node: 10.14.2
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.12
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... elements, forms, language-service, localize
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.901.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.12
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.12
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.12
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.12
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.12 (cli-only)
@angular/cdk                      9.2.4
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.12
@schematics/angular               9.1.12
@schematics/update                0.901.12
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.39.3
Note that my own project along with the Stackblitz repro are both on zone.js 0.10.3.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "zone.js incorrectly throws an error when rejecting a Promise with the `DISABLE_WRAPPING_UNCAUGHT_PROMISE_REJECTION` flag enabled" (#38334)

Issues.Title: fix(service-worker): fix the chrome debugger syntax highlighter
Issues.Body:
The Chrome debugger is not able to render the syntax properly when the
code contains backticks. This is a known issue in Chrome and they have an
open [issue](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=659515) for that.
This commit adds the work-around to use double backslash with one
backtick ``\\` `` at the end of the line.

**Before**

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59734/89206422-4994a100-d587-11ea-88ba-7dfc1e12005a.png)

**After**

Issues.Title: production build of angular takes lot of time
Issues.Body:
I am trying to build my angular project and it takes lots of time(8+ minutes) for building. Below is my docker file. Image is created using Gitlab private runners.

```
FROM node:alpine as builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY .  /app
RUN cd /app && npm set progress=false && npm install
RUN cd /app && node --max_old_space_size=8192 node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng build --aot --prod

FROM nginx:alpine
RUN rm -rf /usr/share/nginx/html/*
COPY --from=builder /app/dist/fdm-apps /usr/share/nginx/html
COPY nginx/nginx-conf.conf /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
WORKDIR /usr/share/nginx/html

EXPOSE 80
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]

```

Here is the angular configurations.

```
"optimization": true,
              "outputHashing": "all",
              "sourceMap": false,
              "extractCss": true,
              "namedChunks": false,
              "aot": true,
              "extractLicenses": true,
              "vendorChunk": false,
              "buildOptimizer": true,
              "budgets": [
                {
                  "type": "initial",
                  "maximumWarning": "3mb",
                  "maximumError": "5mb"
                },
                {
                  "type": "anyComponentStyle",
                  "maximumWarning": "6kb"
                }
              ]
```

Is there any way to bring down my build time?

```
Angular CLI: 9.1.6
Node: 12.18.3
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 9.1.9

```

Issues.Title: @angular/localize should have @babel/core as a devDependency
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/localize

### Is this a regression?
not sure

### Description
`@angular/localize` has `@babel/core` as a dependency, and not a devDependency.

We use BlackDuck for all the license attributions for the code we ship, but because `@babel/core` is include here, all the `@babel/*` and dependencies show up for BlackDuck to generate a report on, and include in our distributed license file even though none of that is browser code that will be shipped to users.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
* Create a new project: `ng create new-project`
* Add @angular/localize: `ng add @angular/localize`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "@angular/localize should have @babel/core as a devDependency" (#38329)

Issues.Title: Service workers registration breaks app in Safari
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/service-worker from at least v8.x till latest version ### Is this a regression? Nope, as far as i can tell the issue was always there ### Description Adding the package to an angular app and registering the module via importing ``` ServiceWorkerModule.register('ngsw-worker.js', { enabled: environment.production }) ``` breaks the app in safari with error ``` TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 't.getSubscription') ``` The error is fired multiple times bringing the app to a crawl and eventually breaking Safari. After a refresh some times you get the following error also ``` Maximum call size exceeded ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/... ## üî• Exception or Error Error seems to come from the following line in the package https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/service-worker/src/push.ts#L151 In constructor of SwPush service the check if service workers is done like this: ``` constructor(private sw: NgswCommChannel) { if (!sw.isEnabled) { this.messages = NEVER; this.notificationClicks = NEVER; this.subscription = NEVER; return; } ``` Specifically for Safari it is the case that service workers are supported but Push API is not. A check like the following seems to be more complete and would guard against this error: ``` if (!sw.isEnabled && !('PushManager' in window || 'pushManager' in ServiceWorkerRegistration.prototype)) ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 8.3.13
Node: 12.13.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 8.2.11
... common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

------------------------------------------------------------

Issues.Title: Dynamic routing and cached routes don't work together
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Not that I'm aware of ### Description There is an issue with dynamic routes and keeping snapshots of components already attached to existing routes. My use case involves adding dynamic routes by calling router resetConfig(routes). Issues.Title: fix(core): queries not matching string injection tokens
Issues.Body:
Queries weren't matching directives that provide themselves via string injection tokens, because the assumption was that any string passed to a query decorator refers to a template reference.

These changes make it so we match both template references and providers while giving precedence to the template references.

Fixes #38313.
Fixes #38315.

Issues.Title: Mark eager `NgModuleFactory` construction as not side effectful
Issues.Body:
Roll forward of #38147.

This allows Closure compiler to tree shake unused constructor calls to `NgModuleFactory`, which is otherwise considered
side-effectful. The Angular compiler generates factory objects which are exported but typically not used, as they are
only needed for compatibility with View Engine. This results in top-level constructor calls, such as:

```typescript
export const FooNgFactory = new NgModuleFactory(Foo);
```

`NgModuleFactory` has a side-effecting constructor, so this statement cannot be tree shaken, even if `FooNgFactory` is
never imported. The `NgModuleFactory` continues to reference its associated `NgModule` and prevents the module and all
its unused dependencies from being tree shaken, making Closure builds significantly larger than necessary.

The fix here is to wrap `NgModuleFactory` constructor with `noSideEffects(() => /* ... */)`, which tricks the Closure
compiler into assuming that the invoked function has no side effects. This allows it to tree-shake unused
`NgModuleFactory()` constructors when they aren't imported. Since the factory can be removed, the module can also be
removed (if nothing else references it), thus tree shaking unused dependencies as expected.

The one notable edge case is for lazy loaded modules. Internally, lazy loading is done as a side effect when the lazy
script is evaluated. For Angular, this side effect is registering the `NgModule`. In Ivy this is done by the
`NgModuleFactory` constructor, so lazy loaded modules **cannot** have their top-level `NgModuleFactory` constructor
call tree shaken. We handle this case by looking for the `id` field on `@NgModule` annotations. All lazy loaded modules
include an `id`. When this `id` is found, the `NgModuleFactory` is generated **without** with `noSideEffects()` call,
so Closure will not tree shake it and the module will lazy-load correctly.

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): update unparsable character reference entity error messages
Issues.Body:
Within an angular template, when a character entity is unable to be parsed, previously a generic unexpected character error was thrown. This does not properly express the issue that was discovered as the issue is actually caused by the discovered character making the whole of the entity unparsable. The compiler will now instead inform via the error message what string was attempted to be parsed and what it was attempted to be parsed as. Example, for this template: ```html

ģp

``` Before this change: `Unexpected character "p"` After this change: `Unable to parse entity "ģp" - hexadecimal character reference entities must end with ";"` Fixes #26067
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler): update unparsable character reference entity error messages" (#38319)

Issues.Title: The @ViewChildren decorator does not select providers defined through string tokens
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report
### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package `@angular/core`.

### Is this a regression?
Yes. This bug was not present before version 9 when Ivy was enabled by default. With ViewEngine, this bug is not present.

### Description
Although not explicitly stated in the [documentation for the `@ViewChildren` decorator](https://angular.io/api/core/ViewChildren), this decorator previously selected providers that were defined through string tokens with ViewEngine. With Ivy enabled, these providers are no longer selected. 

In the [documentation for its counterpart, the `@ViewChild` decorator](https://angular.io/api/core/ViewChild), one of the accepted selectors is stated as:

> Any provider defined through a string token (e.g. @ViewChild('someToken') someTokenVal: any)

This is broken for `@ViewChild` as well. I'm working from the expectation that the acceptable selector types for `@ViewChild` should be the same for `@ViewChildren`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/view-children-string-token-provider-selector

## üî• Exception or Error
No error, `@ViewChildren` just returns undefined values.

Issues.Body:
### Affected Package The issue is most probablycaused by package "@angular/cli": "~10.0.4", ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: I can¬¥t say which was the last version this worked on...most probably 9.x.x, but it worked in versions before ;-) ### Description I generated a new Angular Project with Angular CLI 10.0.4. It generated the project and added the different tsconfig files. Unfortunately I could no longer use auto completion. For example I removed this line from app-routing.module.ts `import { Routes, RouterModule } from '@angular/router';` Then I set my cursor to the end of "Routes" in this line and pressed CMD+Space: `const routes: Routes = [];` But it didn¬¥t suggest me to import from @angular/router. This happens as well with Modules which I generated myself. This issue is due to the tsconfig files: tsconfig.json ``` { "files": [], "references": [ { "path": "./tsconfig.app.json" }, { "path": "./tsconfig.spec.json" } ] } ``` tsconfig.app.json ``` { "extends": "./tsconfig.base.json", "compilerOptions": { "outDir": "./out-tsc/app", "types": [], "paths": { "@task/*": ["src/app/task/*"] } }, "files": ["src/main.ts", "src/polyfills.ts"], "include": ["src/**/*.d.ts"] } ``` tsconfig.base.json ``` { "compileOnSave": false, "compilerOptions": { "baseUrl": "./", "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc", "sourceMap": true, "declaration": false, "downlevelIteration": true, "experimentalDecorators": true, "moduleResolution": "node", "importHelpers": true, "target": "es2015", "module": "es2020", "lib": ["es2018", "dom"] } } ``` If I replace my tsconfig.app.json with a tsconfig from another (older) app, it works. e.g. ``` { "compileOnSave": false, "compilerOptions": { "rootDir": ".", "sourceMap": true, "declaration": false, "moduleResolution": "node", "emitDecoratorMetadata": true, "experimentalDecorators": true, "importHelpers": true, "target": "es2015", "module": "esnext", "typeRoots": ["node_modules/@types"], "lib": ["es2017", "dom"], "skipLibCheck": true, "skipDefaultLibCheck": true, "baseUrl": ".", "paths": { "@customer-request/common-ui": ["libs/common-ui/src/index.ts"], "@customer-request/p-house-connection": ["libs/p-house-connection/src/index.ts"], "@customer-request/p-internet-connection": ["libs/p-internet-connection/src/index.ts"], "@customer-request/auth": ["libs/auth/src/index.ts"] } }, "exclude": ["node_modules", "tmp"] } ``` Nevertheless I want to use the new structure but there seems to be any issue in it. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Generate a new App with version 10.0.4 of Angular CLI and try to auto import any Element like shown above. ## üî• Exception or Error No real Error, intellisense/autocomplete just doesn¬¥t work. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: The @ViewChild decorator does not select providers defined through a string token
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report
### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package `@angular/core`.

### Is this a regression?
Yes. This bug was not present before version 9  when Ivy was enabled by default. With ViewEngine, this bug is not present.


### Description

In the [documentation for the `@ViewChild` decorator](https://angular.io/api/core/ViewChild), one of the accepted selectors is stated as: 
> Any provider defined through a string token (e.g. @ViewChild('someToken') someTokenVal: any)

However, with Ivy enabled, using this type of selector returns an undefined value. With ViewEngine, it works as described and returns a value. 

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/view-child-string-token-provider-selector

## üî• Exception or Error

No error, `@ViewChild` just returns an undefined value. 

## üåç  Your Environment

```
Angular CLI: 10.0.4
Node: 12.9.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.0.7
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.1000.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.1000.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.1000.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.1000.4
@angular-devkit/core              10.0.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        10.0.4
@angular/cli                      10.0.4
@ngtools/webpack                  10.0.4
@schematics/angular               10.0.4
@schematics/update                0.1000.4
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.9.7
webpack                           4.43.0
```

Issues.Title: Using an Angular Decorator like @Output with a string literal class member causes a build error
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli@10.0.6 ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/compiler-cli@10.0.5 ### Description I think this is related to the feature added in PR https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38226 I had some code like this before: ``` @Output() 'did-finish-load' = new EventEmitter(); ``` (`did-finish-load` is the name of an [Electron API](https://www.electronjs.org/docs/api/web-contents#event-did-finish-load) I was using, I was just trying to keep the same naming scheme). It looks like before, output names like `'did-finish-load'` were just ignored completely. In the newer Angular version, it causes a mysterious build error. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I don't think I can control the compiler-cli version on StackBlitz, so I'll submit a github repo. https://github.com/patdx/reproduction-string-literal-angular Steps: 1. npm install 2. ng build 3. You should get the same error as reported below ## üî• Exception or Error I just tried creating a small test: ``` export class AppComponent { @Output() 'did-finish-load-one' = new EventEmitter(); @Output() didFinishLoadTwo = new EventEmitter(); } ``` With `@angular/compiler-cli@10.0.5`, it produced the following code in dist/main.js: ``` class AppComponent { constructor() { this[ "did-finish-load-one" ] = new _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["EventEmitter"](); this.didFinishLoadTwo = new _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__[ "EventEmitter" ](); } } AppComponent.…µfac = function AppComponent_Factory(t) { return new (t || AppComponent)(); }; AppComponent.…µcmp = _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__[ "…µ…µdefineComponent" ]({ type: AppComponent, selectors: [["app-root"]], outputs: { didFinishLoadTwo: "didFinishLoadTwo" }, decls: 0, vars: 0, template: function AppComponent_Template(rf, ctx) {}, encapsulation: 2, }); /*@__PURE__*/ (function () { _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["…µsetClassMetadata"]( AppComponent, [ { type: _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["Component"], args: [ { selector: "app-root", template: "", }, ], }, ], null, { didFinishLoadTwo: [ { type: _angular_core__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["Output"], }, ], } ); })(); ``` This code is running, but "did-finish-load-one" was totally ignored as an output. Oh! Actually, I didn't realize this before. With `@angular/compiler-cli@10.0.6`, I got a build error instead: ```bash # ... chunk {styles} styles.js, styles.js.map (styles) 12.4 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {vendor} vendor.js, vendor.js.map (vendor) 2.07 MB [initial] [rendered] Date: 2020-07-31T04:45:05.022Z - Hash: ad1181a1bd231bc94cd9 - Time: 5662ms ERROR in ./src/app/app.component.ts 17:19 Module parse failed: Unexpected token (17:19) File was processed with these loaders: * ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/index.js You may need an additional loader to handle the result of these loaders. | template: '', | }] > }], null, { did-finish-load-one: [{ | type: Output | }], didFinishLoadTwo: [{ ``` It guess if the compiler supports string literals with decorators like Output, it needs to escape the value here, as in ```diff template: '', }] - }], null, { did-finish-load-one: [{ + }], null, { 'did-finish-load-one': [{ type: Output }], didFinishLoadTwo: [{ ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 10.0.4
Node: 12.3.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.0.7
... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes
**Anything else relevant?** As far as I can tell, all that matters is `@angular/compiler-cli@10.0.5` (ignored but no error) vs `@angular/compiler-cli@10.0.6` (build error).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using an Angular Decorator like @Output with a string literal class member causes a build error" (#38311)

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): [Ivy[ remove temporary compiler
Issues.Body:
Now that Ivy compiler has a proper `TemplateTypeChecker` interface
(see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38105) we no longer need to
keep the temporary compiler implementation.

This commit removes the whole `ivy/compiler` directory and moves two
functions `createTypeCheckingProgramStrategy` and
`getOrCreateTypeCheckScriptInfo` to the `LanguageService` class.

Also re-enable the Ivy LS test since it's no longer blocking development.

Issues.Title: fix(forms): remove validators while cleaning up a control
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, the `cleanUpControl` function (responsible for cleaning up control instance)
was not taking validators into account. As a result, these validators remain registered on a detached
form control instance, thus causing memory leaks. This commit updates the `cleanUpControl` function
logic to also run validators cleanup.

As a part of this change, the logic to setup and cleanup validators was refactored and moved to
separate functions, so that they can be reused in the future.

NOTE: this PR resolves memory leaks in **certain scenarios only**. Other scenarios will be handled in followup PRs.

Issues.Title: Library randomly fails to build consistently, but reports no errors
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [X ] build ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.x ### Description I have an Angular library that I've been trying to update to Angular 10.x. I've noticed that, even without making ANY changes to the library code, it will randomly build differently. I can build it 10 times in a row without making any changes to the code and approximately 50% of the time (or more), it will build in such a way that causes a client application to fail to build. It's important to note that the library itself always appears to build successfully - it produces no noticeable errors. I'm using the "--prod" flag every time to build it with the View engine instead of Ivy. However, the code only works when the dist build includes an "__ivy_ngcc__" directory and a file that ends with ".__ivy_ngcc_bak". There may be other differences in the dist contents as well, but those are the ones that immediately stand out. If the build process fails to produce output that contains those 2 items, then an Angular app that consumes the library fails to build. The consuming application produces errors that say: `ERROR in The target entry-point "[library name]" has missing dependencies:` followed by a long list of items (services, pipes, interfaces, etc.) from the library that it thinks are "missing". I can resolve this by simply rebuilding the library, then the client app several times until the library contains the "ivy_ngcc" items mentioned above - at which point the client app that consumes the library will build successfully. Again... it is my understanding that the "--prod" flag makes the code build with View, not Ivy. So I'm not sure why it ever produces the "ivy_ngcc" items and I'm not sure why it only works when they are present. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Unfortunately, my library is almost 100% proprietary code so I can make it publicly available for testing. However, I can describe the approach that I've taken: 1) I built a brand new workspace, per the Angular library documentation 2) I added a library to the workspace and added a large number of items (services, etc.), contained in about 6 modules. 3) I added a test application to the workspace, which references the library (directly via filesystem reference - not through NPM yet) 4) I'm simply repeating the following commands to test: `ng build my-lib --prod` `ng build my-app` ## üåç Your Environment

OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.0.6

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/devkit-build-angular): simplify Webpack split chunks configuration
Issues.Body: By leveraging the chunks function filter option, the test option can be reduced to only a regular expression instead of the more complex function.  This change also provides support for Webpack 5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular/devkit-build-angular): simplify Webpack split chunks configuration" (#18432)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): lazy load several optional webpack plugins
Issues.Body: Multiple Webpack plugins are only used when certain options are enabled.  By only requiring them when needed, startup time can be reduced by potentially eliminating large dependency hierarchies from being loaded that will then be unused.  This change currently only applies to plugins that are required.  This limitation is due to the current webpack configuration infrastructure being synchronous which prevents dynamic import usage.

Issues.Title: > It happen to me today. Ubuntu, Angular 8, Bootstrap 3.
Issues.Body:
> It happen to me today. Ubuntu, Angular 8, Bootstrap 3.
> Firstly I resolved it by adding `@import "~bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css";` into styles.css but then I decided to look more into it and I compare angular.json file one from the previous projects where Bootstrap 3 was loading without issues. It is only that "Meld" (compare tool) reveled to me that in a hurry erroneously I added path to the bootstrap ` "styles": [ "node_modules/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css", "src/styles.css" ],`
> under the **"test"** section instead under "architect" section.
> Once moved to ""architect" section, bootstrap started loading.

Thanks i have the same problem and it's work now

_Originally posted by @MohamedAbdeljelil in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/3411#issuecomment-522493940_

Issues.Title: "ng build" showing "ERROR in No NgModule metadata found for 'AppModule'" instead of detailed root errors
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description In JIT build mode (AOT=false), "ng build" keeps reporting "ERROR in No NgModule metadata found for 'AppModule'" instead of showing detailed root issues - Lambda not supported in 'app-routing.module.ts' ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Root issue - **app-routing.module.ts** ```typescript import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'; import { PreloadAllModules, RouterModule, Routes } from '@angular/router'; const routes: Routes = [ { path: '', loadChildren: () => import('./tabs/tabs.module').then(m => m.TabsPageModule) } ]; @NgModule({ imports: [ RouterModule.forRoot(routes, { preloadingStrategy: PreloadAllModules }) ], exports: [RouterModule] }) export class AppRoutingModule { } ``` ## üî• Exception or Error The error caught during grabbing **AppModule**'s metadata. In the error details, it says the error will be reported, but it didn't. Without debugging, I only see error 'ERROR in No NgModule metadata found for 'AppModule' reported by Angular CLI. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3407775/89125370-ea159300-d4ab-11ea-849a-aa6f890b0dc8.png) ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/schematics): add includeStyles option on component
Issues.Body:
There are several use cases where we create components knowing there will be no styles attached.
To keep them as simple as possible, there should be an option to create them without any styles/stylesUrl property into the @Component metadata.

new Component schematic option
```
"includeStyles": {
      "description": "Specifies if the component should include styles",
      "type": "boolean",
      "default": true,
      "alias": "is"
    }
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@schematics/schematics): add includeStyles option on component" (#18420)

Issues.Title: feat(schematics/component): add a includeStyles option
Issues.Body:
There are several use cases where we create components knowing there will be no styles attached.
To keep them as simple as possible, there should be an option to create them without any styles/stylesUrl property into the @Component metadata.

## new Component schematic option

```
"includeStyles": {
      "description": "Specifies if the component should include a styles property",
      "type": "boolean",
      "default": true,
      "alias": "is"
    }
```

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
The `ng build --prod --localize` build assets in each locale that the application has. An option to build assets only for one locale and reusing them will be a great way to minimize the time of the building of server.

Issues.Title: Can't user translation file for en-US: "An i18n locale ('en-US') cannot both be a source locale and provide a translation"
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report I can't use a translation file for en-US: ```json i18n": { "locales": { "en-US": { "baseHref": "delete/us/en_us", "translation": "messages.en-us.xlf" } } } ``` ### Description - Our app is translated into 40+ languages - We want our translation department to be responsible for all strings - We want to ignore the strings our developers have written in the HTML files - Therefore we need one build per messages.xlf file and no build for the "sourceLocale" - At the moment we are forced to manually copy the strings from the messages.en-us.xlf file back into our HTML every time our translation department makes a change to en-US Possible solutions: - Allow `"translation"` as a property of `"sourceLocale"` ```json "sourceLocale": { "code": "en-US", "translation": "messages.en-us.xlf" } ``` - Add option to prevent the build of the source locale ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/MartinJaskulla/angular-issue-38316 ## üî• Exception or Error 

An unhandled exception occurred: An i18n locale ('en-US') cannot both be a source locale and provide a translation.
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.7
Node: 12.13.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.0.7
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.900.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.900.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.900.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.900.7
@angular-devkit/core              9.0.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.0.7
@angular/localize                 9.1.12
@ngtools/webpack                  9.0.7
@schematics/angular               9.0.7
@schematics/update                0.900.7
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.7.5
webpack                           4.41.2
**Anything else relevant?** I know that there are several workarounds. For example we could provide a non-existent source locale `"sourceLocale": "aa-aa"` and delete the build afterwards. However our app is very big and we want to save the build time. Furthermore our actual setup is more complex than the example provided above. For example the translations for the same locale e.g. my-app.com/de/en-US and my-app.com/us/en-US can be different. It would be useful for angular.json to provide some sort of nesting of the locales.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can't user translation file for en-US: "An i18n locale ('en-US') cannot both be a source locale and provide a translation"" (#18422)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): prefer workspace node_modules
Issues.Body:
In Webpack absolute and relative paths in resolve.module and resolveLoader.modules  behave differently.

A relative path will be scanned similarly to how Node scans for node_modules, by looking through the current directory as well as its ancestors (i.e. ./node_modules, ../node_modules, and on).

With an absolute path, it will only search in the given directory.

With this change we give preference to the workspace level node_nodules directory.

Modules resolved with this change

Issues.Title: Option's panel doesn't position/aligned with mat-select for some last options
Issues.Body:
If a mat-select is placed at the bottom side of the screen then it's getting offsetY value which is moving the vertical position of the option's panel and is not aligned with the position of the drop down itself.

Repro steps:
1. Select a value "Tomato" or below from the dropdown.
2. Click on drop down again to open the option's panel.
3. Option's panel is not aligned with the drop down. 

Actual alignment:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19508824/89236150-aa7ea200-d5a4-11ea-8925-b65062a9f236.png)

Expected alignment:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19508824/89235986-33490e00-d5a4-11ea-9190-8caa547d189b.png)

Stackblitz repro:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/mat-select-bug-uc8m2c?file=src%2Fapp%2Fmat-select-bug.html

Angular: 10.0.0

Issues.Title: fix(cdk-experimental/menu): re-open menu on hover after click to close on trigger
Issues.Body:
When hovering back over a menu item trigger in a menu bar which was clicked to open then closed, it
opens the submenu. This ensures that a menu attached to a trigger in a menu bar only opens on hover
if it has a sibling open.

Issues.Title: feat(cdk-experimental/menu): enable keyboard handling for context menu
Issues.Body:
By default on both Mac and Windows the context menu keyboard trigger is emitted as a contextmenu
mouse event automatically, eliminating the need to handle keyboard events specifically for context
menus. Therefore, this simply places focus on the first menu item in the opened context menu
relying on the existing menu and menu item keyboard handling logic.

Issues.Title: feat(MatListItem): Add active / selected state for MatListItem
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description The component `MatListItem` is very useful for creating mobile hamburger-style navigations (relying on `MatNavList`). It would be nice to have the equivalent of what `MatListOption` has. On horizontal links using tabs we can do ```html
{{route.name}}
``` I am proposing to be able to do: ```html {{route.name}} ``` #### Use Case Before: ![Screenshot 2020-08-03 at 19 04 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/364033/89208204-36e88f00-d5bc-11ea-895e-6c3ac9a51724.png) After (example): ![Screenshot 2020-08-03 at 19 04 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/364033/89208214-3b14ac80-d5bc-11ea-8a7a-1571f1824066.png) #### Current workaround and behavior We can do: ```html {{route.name}} ``` and have ``` .is-active { background: mat-color($gray, 700); } ``` But I think I rather have the Material team design it instead of myself (the default CSS part) plus `[active]` is just a tiny bit cleaner than `class.is-active`. Thoughts?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(MatListItem): Add active / selected state for MatListItem" (#20166)

Issues.Body:

Also cleans up a few getters that were returning observables.

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk-experimental/menu): move listeners from host object to host listener decorator
Issues.Body:
Some of the Cdk directives are expected to be extended by some subclasses (e.g. material). In Ivy
the host metadata will be merged whereas in ViewEngine it will be overridden forcing duplication of
listeners in the host object on the subclass which results in double listeners in Ivy. Moving to
@HostListener prevents having to duplicate them in subclasses.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(cdk-experimental/menu): move listeners from host object to host listener decorator" (#20164)

Issues.Title: bug(select): disableOptionCentering not working if control at bottom of the page
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8rmfbm?file=src%2Fapp%2Fselect-custom-trigger-example.ts
2. In that sample in all drop downs the Tomato option present at the last is selected on load but see the 3rd drop down it is not able to show options dialog properly
3. I tried using panelClass and keeping position: relative or absolute and giving top, left but it didn't help
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
No matter where the mat select is placed in the page the drop down should open properly if it is at the top the drop down should open top-to-bottom (works fine) and if it's at the bottom bottom-to-top but it fails in this case bottom to top it doesn't render properly

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The selected option is not visible when the drop down present at the bottom of the page is opened it is being cut off from the view port or page due to the scroll position not going to the proper place

#### Environment

- Angular: 8,9,10
- CDK/Material: 8,9,10
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

To reproduce the issue with less drop downs I used div's with position absolute but even if we keep so many drops one after the other the same issue comes.

Also I want to position the options dialog a bit farther from the control itself for top and middle ones the options dialog should open below the control and form mat-select at the bottom of the page it should have bottom margin or come upwards for it I tried so but it is not working properly

.myPanelClass {
  position: relative;
  top: 30px;
  left: 28px;
}

<mat-select disableOptionCentering panelClass="myPanelClass" [formControl]="toppings1" multiple>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17563774/89183109-65626c00-d5b4-11ea-81e1-0bcd8c192b4e.png)

with myPanelClass the bottom one opens up like this

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17563774/89183181-78753c00-d5b4-11ea-97f8-6e82a6daba9b.png)

Note: my drop downs are not only static but also dynamic in some cases so many drop downs in a page are rendered using *ngFor
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(select): disableOptionCentering not working if control at bottom of the page" (#20163)

Issues.Title: bug(MatProgressSpinner): Progress spinner circle expands beyond the specified diameter
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Create a progress spinner with a stroke width greater than 10.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-hjmhk7?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html
 
#### Expected Behavior

The spinner circle should remain within the specified diameter as with the parent progress-spinner element.

#### Actual Behavior

The spinner circle expands outside its parent progress-spinner element and beyond the specified diameter. The circle will continue to expand as the stroke width is increased, potentially overlapping adjacent components.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8414922/89133337-e79a5400-d512-11ea-804b-58631b3eddda.png)

#### Notes

This is related to the way the circle radius is calculated here:

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/294b8ee3c969e0550238ccbe8df1722c1c4e9318/src/material/progress-spinner/progress-spinner.ts#L233-L235

Subtracting a `STROKE_WIDTH` constant of 10 means that the circle element will only have the correct size when the spinner stroke width is 10. 

#### Related Issues

#19469 - The use of STROKE_WIDTH in the radius calculation also prevents progress spinners of diameter <= 10 from being shown.

Opening this issue based on discussion in a related PR https://github.com/angular/components/pull/20062

#### Environment

Environment
Angular: 10.0.7
CDK/Material: 10.1.1
Browser(s): Google Chrome Version 84.0.4147.105
Operating System: Windows 10 version 1909
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatProgressSpinner): Progress spinner circle expands beyond the specified diameter" (#20159)

Issues.Title: bug(MatProgressSpinner): Progress spinner animation fails for floating point diameter values
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Create a progress spinner with an indeterminate mode and floating point diameter.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-tcz3y5?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html 
  
#### Expected Behavior

The spinner should show a spinning animation.

#### Actual Behavior

The spinner appears as a complete circle. Screenshot below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8414922/89132805-d2232b00-d50e-11ea-899e-fb894e143a19.png)

#### Notes

If the diameter is a floating point value it will have a period ‚Äò.‚Äô when converted to a string. This string is then used in the animation-name, but the animation-name CSS property does not support period ‚Äò.‚Äô characters. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-name 

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/294b8ee3c969e0550238ccbe8df1722c1c4e9318/src/material/progress-spinner/progress-spinner.html#L28

Worth noting that the float point diameters are supported for the spinners in determinate mode.

#### Environment

Angular: 10.0.7
CDK/Material: 10.1.1
Browser(s): Google Chrome Version 84.0.4147.105
Operating System: Windows 10 version 1909
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatProgressSpinner): Progress spinner animation fails for floating point diameter values" (#20158)

Issues.Title: fix(platform): detect and ignore scrollBehavior polyfills
Issues.Body:
We use the `supportsScrollBehavior` function to check whether to try and pass in the scroll options object to `Scrollable.scrollTo` since passing it in on a browser that doesn't support it won't do anything. The problem is that the only way to detect if scroll behavior is supported is to look for the `scrollBehavior` property on a DOM element's CSS styles, however this will cause scroll behavior polyfills to be ignored since they only modify `Element.prototype.scrollTo`.

These changes try to detect whether `scrollTo` has been polyfilled, and if it has, we consider it as being supported.

Fixes #17847.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(platform): detect and ignore scrollBehavior polyfills" (#20155)

Issues.Title: Multiple Pagination(Mat-table & Pagination): Multiple pagination in same component with different data source not working
Issues.Body:
#### Description
I tried to put two tables in one component with different data sources which worked well with the data rending part. However, the paginator didn't work on the second table. 

#### Reproduction
Please use StackBlitz to check the issue: 
**StackBlitz Project Editor link**: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-brxwzo
**StackBlitz Output link**: https://angular-brxwzo.stackblitz.io

#### Steps to reproduce:
1. Create two table
2. Create two data sources with different numbers of elements into it.
3. Bind the data source with the respective data source for eg. 
`  displayedColumns: string[] = ['position', 'name', 'weight', 'symbol'];
  dataSource = new MatTableDataSource<PeriodicElement>(ELEMENT_DATA);
  dataSource1 = new MatTableDataSource<PeriodicElement>(myData);
`
 **Table 1**
`<table mat-table [dataSource]="dataSource">
`
**Table 2**
`  <table mat-table [dataSource]="dataSource1">`
4. Create the paginator for the following datasouces:
`  @ViewChild(MatPaginator, {static: true}) paginator: MatPaginator;
  @ViewChild(MatPaginator, {static: true}) paginator2: MatPaginator;`
 5. Only the first paginator will work in the output.

#### Expected Behavior

Like the first table pagination, the second table pagination should also work independently to the first as the data sources are different, the paginator pointing instance is different.


#### Actual Behavior

Only the first table pagination is working rest of all other table pagination are begin ignored.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.5
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu 20.01
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multiple Pagination(Mat-table & Pagination): Multiple pagination in same component with different data source not working" (#20154)

Issues.Title: slider: not sliding anymore after the version 9.2.0 with Capacitor JS
Issues.Body:
## Bug
